sen.j: 春日若宮おん祭（かすがわかみやおんまつり）は、奈良県奈良市の春日大社の摂社若宮で行われる祭礼である。
sen.e: Kasuga Wakamiya Onmatsuri is a festival held at Sesha Wakamiya shrine (a subordinate shrine) of Kasuga-taisha Shrine in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
Kasuga Wakamiya Onmatsuri is a festival held at Sesha Wakamiya shrine (a subordinate shrine) of Kasuga-taisha Shrine in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
Kasuga Wakamiya Onmatsuri is a festival held at Sesha Wakamiya shrine (a subordinate shrine) of Kasuga-taisha Shrine in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 「春日若宮おん祭の神事芸能」は重要無形民俗文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: "The entertainments performed at the shrine ritual of Kasuga Wakamiya Onmatsuri" has been designated as an important intangible folk cultural property.
sen.cmt: 定訳不明→「春日若宮おん祭の神事芸能」
sen.e: "The entertainments performed at the shrine ritual of Kasuga Wakamiya Onmatsuri" has been designated as an important intangible folk cultural property.
"The entertainments performed at the shrine ritual of Kasuga Wakamiya Onmatsuri" has been designated as an important intangible folk cultural property.

sen.j: 社伝神楽や東遊、田楽や細男が行われる。
sen.e: Shaden-kagura (the sacred music and dancing which have been performed in the shrine since long time ago), Azuma-asobi (a traditional sacred performance of Japanese song and dance), Dengaku (a ritual music and dancing performed before rice planting for wishing good harvests), and Seino (a dance performed by six men, wearing a kariginu [informal clothes worn by Court nobles] and Tate-boshi hat, at the festival) are performed.
sen.cmt: 定訳不明→「社伝神楽」「東遊」「田楽」「細男」一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shaden-kagura (the sacred music and dancing which have been performed in the shrine since long time ago), Azuma-asobi (a traditional sacred performance of Japanese song and dance), Dengaku (a ritual music and dancing performed before rice planting for wishing good harvests), and Seino (a dance performed by six men, wearing a kariginu [informal clothes worn by Court nobles] and Tate-boshi hat, at the festival) are performed.

Shaden-kagura (the sacred music and dancing which have been performed in the shrine since long time ago), Azuma-asobi (a traditional sacred performance of Japanese song and dance), Dengaku (a ritual music and dancing performed before rice planting for wishing good harvests), and Seino (a dance performed by six men, wearing a kariginu [informal clothes worn by Court nobles] and Tate-boshi hat, at the festival) are performed.

sen.j: 三方楽所南都方の伝統を受け継ぐ「南都楽所」による舞楽が行われる。
sen.e: Bugaku (a traditional Japanese court music accompanied by dancing) is performed by "Nanto-gakuso" (the gagaku [ceremonial court music of Japan]) performance group based in Nanto [Kofuku-ji temple in Nara Prefecture]) which inherits the tradition of Sanpo-gakuso Nanto-gata ("Sanpo-gakuso" is the collective name of three gagaku performance groups, "Kyuchu-gata" [the Imperial Court in Kyoto Prefecture], "Nanto-gata" [Kofuku-ji temple in Nara Prefecture], and "Tenno-ji-gata" [Shitenno-ji temple in Osaka Prefecture]).
sen.cmt: 定訳不明→「三方楽所南都方」「南都楽所」一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Bugaku (a traditional Japanese court music accompanied by dancing) is performed by "Nanto-gakuso" (the gagaku [ceremonial court music of Japan]) performance group based in Nanto [Kofuku-ji temple in Nara Prefecture]) which inherits the tradition of Sanpo-gakuso Nanto-gata ("Sanpo-gakuso" is the collective name of three gagaku performance groups, "Kyuchu-gata" [the Imperial Court in Kyoto Prefecture], "Nanto-gata" [Kofuku-ji temple in Nara Prefecture], and "Tenno-ji-gata" [Shitenno-ji temple in Osaka Prefecture]).

Bugaku (a traditional Japanese court music accompanied by dancing) is performed by "Nanto-gakuso" (the gagaku [ceremonial court music of Japan]) performance group based in Nanto [Kofuku-ji temple in Nara Prefecture]) which inherits the tradition of Sanpo-gakuso Nanto-gata ("Sanpo-gakuso" is the collective name of three gagaku performance groups, "Kyuchu-gata" [the Imperial Court in Kyoto Prefecture], "Nanto-gata" [Kofuku-ji temple in Nara Prefecture], and "Tenno-ji-gata" [Shitenno-ji temple in Osaka Prefecture]).

sen.j: 「大和一国を挙げて盛大に執り行われた。
sen.e: The whole Yamato country celebrated the festival with splendor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The whole Yamato country celebrated the festival magnificently.
sen.cmt: magnificentlyのほうがよいと思います。
sen.e: The whole Yamato country celebrated the festival magnificently.

sen.j: 八百六十有余年にわたり途切れることなく開催されている。
sen.e: This festival has been held without a break for more than 860 years.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This festival has been held continuosly for more than 860 years.
sen.cmt: continuoslyのほうがスムーズだと思います。
sen.e: This festival has been held continuosly for more than 860 years.
Origin
Origin
Origin

sen.j: 1135年（保延元年）藤原忠通によって若宮の社殿が改築された。
sen.e: In 1135, the main building of Wakamiya shrine (a shrine sacred to the son of the god of the main shrine) was renovated by Tadamichi FUJIWARA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1135, the main building of Wakamiya shrine (a shrine sacred to the son of the god of the main shrine) was renovated by Tadamichi FUJIWARA.
In 1135, the main building of Wakamiya shrine (a shrine sacred to the son of the god of the main shrine) was renovated by Tadamichi FUJIWARA.

sen.j: その翌年から行われているという。
sen.e: It is said that since the following year, the festival has been celebrated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that the festival has been celebrated since the following year.
sen.cmt: 読みやすいように順序を変えました。
sen.e: It is said that the festival has been celebrated since the following year.
Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 若宮をお迎えする「遷幸の儀」から若宮をお還しする「還幸の儀」までの祭祀は24時間で執り行われる。
sen.e: The whole process of the festival takes 24 hours from beginning to end, starting with "Senko-no-gi" which is a ceremony to welcome the young princess and ending with "Kanko-no-gi" which is a ceremony to send the prince back.
sen.cmt: 定訳不明→「遷幸の儀」「還幸の儀」
sen.e: The whole process of the festival takes 24 hours from beginning to end, starting with "Senko-no-gi" which is a ceremony to welcome the young princess and ending with "Kanko-no-gi" which is a ceremony to send the prince back.

The whole process of the festival takes 24 hours from beginning to end, starting with "Senko-no-gi" which is a ceremony to welcome the young princess and ending with "Kanko-no-gi" which is a ceremony to send the prince back.

sen.j: 12月17日午前零時から始り、12月18日の午前零時になる前に御帰りになる。
sen.e: The festival starts from midnight on December 17 and the price goes back until midnight on December 18.
The festival starts from midnight on December 17 and the prince goes back until midnight on December 18.
sen.cmt: 綴りミスを修正しました。
sen.e: The festival starts from midnight on December 17 and the prince goes back until midnight on December 18.

sen.j: この間「遷幸の儀」「還幸の儀」ともに一切の照明および写真・ビデオの撮影は禁止されている。
sen.e: During from the "Senko-no-gi" to "Kanko-no-gi," turning on a light, taking a photograph, and recording a video tape are prohibited.
sen.cmt: 定訳不明→「遷幸の儀」「還幸の儀」
sen.e: During both "Senko-no-gi" and "Kanko-no-gi," turning on lights, taking photographs, and recording video tapes are prohibited.
During both "Senko-no-gi" and "Kanko-no-gi," turning on lights, taking photographs, and recording video tapes are prohibited.
